Reviews.Title: “Professional, clean, friendly and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Peter C
Reviews.Content: I enjoy staying at this hotel. It has been my second stay. They are friendly, professional and the rooms are very large with a furnished suite. The location could not be beaten being right in the heart of Zona Rosa and steps away from everything central in Mexico. But there are some needed improvements. First of all the room and furnishings.The overall rooms need upgrading. The carpeting, bed sheets and furniture is old and musty and could use a more comfortable and contemporary appearence. The breakfast was plentiful but milk warm for cereal. I think it needs to be refridgerated. The waitress was terrible. I often had to ask her to come out to serve me coffee. The computer is something out of 1990 and badly needs upgrading with more of them. All in all, however, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Zona Rosa is not a good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: mexicanaxelmundo
Reviews.Content: People the Zona Rosa is convenient if it´s for business since Reforma is nearby but it caters to "lonely" businessmen. Depends what you´re looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Weird experiance at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Anchorage
Reviews.Content: Okay so I didn't get why there were almost a hundred people out in front of the hotel. Turns out there was a celebrity music group staying here. Upon further investigation this music group had almost 2 million hits on YouTube but I still had no idea who these guys were but their presence in this hotel wreaked havoc and caused quite a disturbance with paparazzi and fans trying to snap pictures, sneak in for autographs, going down halls, etc. The group was traveling with an entourage of security which didn't make much of a difference. The police stood outside of the hotel and for 3 days straight these fans would come and go at all hours. For starters I am not a picky traveler all I desire is a decent bed in a clean room with peace and quite. However, I got more then I bargained for at this hotel. Yes, it's close to all the boutiques, shopping, bars, Starbucks, Mcdonalds, and enough 711's your head would spin. To make a long story short this hotel is average for what you expect in Mexico. The rooms are clean however are small and the published photos are somewhat misleading giving you the perception the room is large. The plus was there was a nice size refrigerator to chill wine and beverages in the room. In the end would I stay here again... yes but with mixed feelings.

Reviews.Title: “DANGER FRONT DESK”
Reviews.Author: Thomas B
Reviews.Content: I was travel sick and leaving room at 1:30 in afternoon (late) after numerous calls and knocks on door. The front desk actually brought a police officer to my door to evict me and then tried to charge another full night while officer stood immediately behind me at desk.. Beware of managers in this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: rfoxCanada
Reviews.Content: It's a warm sunny day in Mexico City and a quick walk-through the Zona Rosa and you're struck with the bee-hive activity style of the city. One hotel that impressed us was the Zona Rosa Suites with it's more than inviting smorgsaboard, excellent front desk customer service and well appointed room(s). After inspecting one of their rooms it was obvious to us that this is a "must stay at" hotel next time in town. The room was spacious, clean and and well laid out.The price is also very respectful to the customer. For something a little more upscale there is always the Hotel Geneve almost across the street. So much choice in such a small area.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Chihuas1976
Reviews.Content: I didn't book in advance any hotel in Mexico City and I checked a couple of hotels before to make a decition. This hotel was not the cheapest but it has excellent manners. When we were to book our room there isn't any non smoker room so they upgraded our room for free. Bed was ok and clean, bathroom clean and good conditions but it requieres a little attention. WiFi good. Televisions are CTR's but they're good. Our resting was great, but at 7:00 am it started a loud noise by our neighbours when they took a shower and when they go to wc, its really noisy at that time, affotunaly it was not a problem for us because it was the time my alarm clock rang. But buffete it was amazing it doesnt show a lot of dishes but the dishes shown are great! good quality, good flavor, and variety is good enogh. Absolutly I'll spend my nights in that city in that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good as usual”
Reviews.Author: AusverGeorge
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times in this hotel. Even though I had once a bad experience, the rest of my stays have been really good. Location is the prime reason for me to choose to stay here but they serve nice breakfast, too. And the rooms are so spacious that the feeling is to be in your own apartment. I like the fact that I can receive visits from friends and we seat at the lounge area in the room, not feeling we are at a hotel. Gym coud be improved, as machines are a bit too old and not always working properly. But in general, a good place to stay, as it has usually been.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Irene N
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights and couldn't get over the size of the suite for the price I paid. It was so nice to have a separate living room area to relax in. I found the staff very helpful and accommodating during my stay. I did use the small gym area which was quite adequate. Overall I was very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Zona Rosa action, nice breakfast, take the stairs”
Reviews.Author: cdub333
Reviews.Content: You're in the heart of Zona Rosa action...great outdoor eateries, happening nightclubs, live music, 24-hour groceries. We were there on a weekend and a live band was grinding away across the street, but our hotel room was fairly quiet. (We weren't facing the street, though.) Nice vista of Zona Rosa from hotel rooftop, helps you get perspective. Spacious room, coffeemaker, problem-free plumbing, lockbox. Grungy carpet, but otherwise clean. Shower warm (but not hot), thin towels, poorly-lit. Really slow elevators (take the stairs). Helpful staff; check-in took too long, but check-out was quick. Complimentary Spanish-language daily newspapers. The rate included a breakfast buffet which was 4-star: pleasant dining area with a view of the bustling street, icy cold jugo de naranja, perfect quesadillas. If you like walking for hours around Mexico City like I do or doing the Zona Rosa shopping-clubbing scene, this is a good home base.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: fmadera
Reviews.Content: 2 out of the 5 days I stayed my room was not clean until after 6:30 , and once of those times despite I told the man in the reception about this issue at around 4 pm by 6 the room was still not clean. The room was very very noisy , so every time somebody upstairs goes to the toilet you hear it, and they have an affinity for making repairs at early hours that just adds to the noise. Also DO NOT use the telephone! they charge uber expensive fees, I used mine to call local cellphone numbers (only to say , OK I'm here, or I'm cumming, or Meet me here) and at the end of the stay the amount I had to pay was around 89% the price of one night stay. It is with this kind of extra fees that they make their profit I guess. Never , never again this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Two rooms for the price of one”
Reviews.Author: Vadim0001
Reviews.Content: The title says it all: this hotel offers suites for the price of a room. Convenient location, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge rooms, but an older hotel”
Reviews.Author: transithopper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Eurostars Zona Rosa twice for business. I picked this hotel because I wanted to be in an area where I can find food and services 24 hours a day (I tend to get back to the hotel late at nights). This hotel is in the heart of Zona Rosa. You are within walking distance to dozens of restaurants and convenience stores, some open 24 hours. There is always people on the street (even at 2am). If you look like a male tourist, you will be harassed by touts trying to pull you into one of the many area strip clubs. I just ignore them as part of the scenery, but it may bother others. All the rooms are suites. They are huge, with a separate living room with sofa, coffee table, TV and mini-fridge, a bathroom area, and the bedroom. They are effectively one bedroom apartments, and can probably accommodate an entire family comfortably. The hotel itself is older, and appears to be a bit run-down. The bed and linens are spotless and clean, and the staff does their best to keep up the place. But the fixtures and furnishings are due for an overhaul. There is Internet Wifi, but it can be unreliable (hard to keep a constant connection up). It can be difficult to get to this hotel with taxi, since most taxi drivers do not know where it is. I usually have to tell them to go to the nearby Hotel Geneve or Plaza la Rosa. If that doesn't work, I tell them to go to Zona Rosa at the intersection of Londres y Insurgentes (it is a 3 minute walk from the intersection). The Metrobus is easier (a short distance to the stop on Insurgentes). If I were visiting Zona Rosa (or nearby Polanco and Reforma), I would stay at this hotel again. However, I am staying at a different hotel for my business visits. And if you are a tourist, you may want to consider something closer to Centro Historico.

Reviews.Title: “A real pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Santafeguy
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with excellent accomodations. Our suite had a nice comfortable living room and spacious bedroom. Every thing was as good or better than a lot of hotel that charge far more. The staff is outstanding, friendly and helpful. The breakfast in the morning is more than adequate. We would definately return. I have read other reviews which complained about the suites being dirty and noisy--this was not our experience. Excellent restaurants within easy walking distance--the Konditeri just around the corner was a great place for a nice meal although we moved around Mexico City seeing friends. Try it you'll like it!

Reviews.Title: “Small business hotel. Great value for the vacationers,”
Reviews.Author: Mortakye
Reviews.Content: Staff are very helpful and pleasant. Rooms--you get a suite--were nice sized. The bed was clean if a little hard. The floor covering in the bedroom needs replacing but was clean. In the living/dining area, the floor was not entirely clean. I removed some crud with a sani-wipe but overall the place was clean. I walked around in light stocking feet and noticed no pickup from the floor. Noise is a big problem if you are street -side--Londres. Try to reserve an 01-03. You stand a better chance of sleeping at night, especially Friday and Saturday, if you are a light sleeper. I was awakened, on occasion, by very loud music or police sirens. Keeping your window open in this neighbourhood is just not an option at night, especially if your room is 04-06. Remember, it's a business hotel, so there is no lobby to speak of, which means no people watching in the hotel but step outside the front door and it is overload. The things you will see in that neighbourhood will amaze you. The hotel needs an upgrade in the coming years or it will start to appear run-down, but for now it is in decent condition, great value and centrally located. Remember that every time some minor irritant occurs. It is great value, in decent condition and centrally located. The Metro is just two blocks away. Use it, it is wonderful, goes almost everywhere, and only 30 pesos a ride (27 cents). Walk the city if you can, it is the only way to see it. The neighbourhood is seedy, but in a good sense. It's name, Zone Rosa, means Red Zone, and on offer are all the carnal delights that money can buy. What is fascinating is you have all this heterosexual activity going on in the heart of what is now the gay district of Mexico City, and they get along just fine. Finally, I have never seen as many police officers in any city I have every visited, as I did in the areas I visited in Mexico City. I never felt unsafe and I walked back to my hotel from Condesa after dinner at 10 and 11pm. I took the Metro to Polanca and downtown without a problem. I heard someone say there was 1 police officer for every 10 residents. That cannot be but there can be now doubt that Mexico City has one of the highest ratios of police to civilians. They were everywhere I went. The greater the risk (neighboourhood, hour of day, etc.), the larger the police presence. I felt so safe and the locals remarked that they were there for tourists. I suspect there's more to it than that but I was happy to see them. Mexico City is safe. Probably safer than most American cities.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: NessyBear
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel could use a little tlc here and there (worn out carpets) it is clean and its in the middle of everything. The rooms are spacious and you can get a decent sleep - although my friends think otherwise cause their room was facing the street and according to them it was noisy. If you are planning to rent a car and park it at the hotel make sure it is a small car, we rented a Toyota Odyssey and they told us it was too big for the garage so we ended up using the parking in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I paid 90usd per night and it is not worth even half! It was a nightmare I could not sleep any of my 5 nights, I am completely u”
Reviews.Author: Dklectic
Reviews.Content: I'll tell you my experience; I got a room in 10th floor and I was so excited hopIng I was getting a great view; Surprise all I could see was roofs.. 1 carpets filthy , dark stains, ripped 2 beed: sheets felt like news paper, pillows are hard and too tall 3 the windows Curtain next to sink made me want to throw up everytime I had to brush my teeth rigt next to it. 4 toilet wouldn't flush down completely so the bath room was always stinky and the exhaust fan was extremely noisy 5 The worst part NOISE The walls between rooms are plasterboard is suspect because I could hear neghbours chatting and laughing all night, second night there is a (crappy gym) on he level above and I could hear he treadmil around 10 pm like if it was next to my bed , after he finish around 11:30pm I realized that the little fridge wAs making a horrible sound so I decided toturn it off, then when I pit he t volume down I hear a funny (annoyng ) noise coming out of it so I had to turn it off as welll, and when I was just about to fall sleep the neighbors from right side decided to take a shower and god it was noisy, he noise wouldn't stop for so lon that i started wonderin if it the was a pool party on the higher floor and so I called the guys from reception, after calling twice at 4am they came to my room and they could hear that the noise was from next door , it was 3 guys taking a shower one by one whilst drinking ... After they finish showering I was all set to have a little sleep before I had to wake up 8am and guess what they left their bath's exhaust fan on and the noise was killing me... Third night similar and forth as well, I couldnt leave the hotel because I had a course there at the convention centre wher by the way the provided cookies and coffe where disgusting just like the included breakfast! Where I found a bowl of very old dried fruit filled with fungus... It all real no dramas! Think twice before putting your self through this .. It's a real nightmare!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience..!!”
Reviews.Author: kavitag
Reviews.Content: I liked the location of this hotel, as it is near to one of the famous places in Mexico City, Angel of Independence. The mall across the reforma made the weekends lively. The ambience of the rooms and the cleanliness of the rooms was amazing. The rooms were quiet. The gym on the top floor made the workouts enjoyable by having the look at the city. Had a lively stay in this hotel..!!

Reviews.Title: “Still the best hotel in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: darrenbayley
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed Zona Rosa Suites on numerous occasions in the past and you can refer to any of my previous reviews for further information about the hotel itself. The location and value for money offered by this hotel mean that it is still the best value for money in the City. Still highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: M_Davidsen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eurostars Zona Rosa for two nights. The rooms are spacious and it's not often, that you get a living room and a bedroom just when ordering a double room. Breakfast was average. The facilities on the top floor (jacuzzi, terrace and gym) are a bit overrated. The view from the terrace is not fantastic due to high walls, and there are no sunbeds, and in general the chairs are worn out. The jacuzzi was empty and it seems it was a long since it had been used. The gym was ok, but the weightlifts were outdated. The best things about the hotel is that the rooms are in good quality and the location is fantastic, extremely close to Insurgentes metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MikeFromLondon007
Reviews.Content: The manager, Antonio, could not do enough to help us. It my friends wedding night and he made sure that the happy couple had everything that they desired and even arranged for private time with Champagne in the hot tub on the roof. The hotel suites are spacious, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “I moved from Casa Gonzales to Eurostars Zona Rosa Suites”
Reviews.Author: BerkeleyEducator
Reviews.Content: Eurostars is not your charming full of sixteenth century tile kind of place. But, you seriously get a suite. I didn't really need the extra lounge area, but it was nice. The rooms have a fridge, coffee maker (coffee, sugar, creamer), programmable safe, 2 TV's (one for the bedroom, one for the lounge, air conditioning that works. The bathroom has a nice large, deep bathtub. I stayed here twice this month. The first time I stayed on a Saturday night on a weekend trip from Cuernavaca. When I was leaving Mexico I decided to spend a couple of days in Mexico City. I thought I'd try a new hotel so I went to Casa Gonzales because the reviews said it was nice. Big mistake. Drunken college kids. Dirty room on first floor with a broken window. I'm not paranoid. But, come on... someone could have climbed right in while I was sleeping. Casa Gonzales is for people (mostly American) who are afraid of encountering a Mexican person without an American to help them. So, I went back to Eurostars where the staff do speak English Thank God they had a room. It was $5 dollars more the Casa Gonzales. Eurostars isn't perfect. It can be a little noisy on a Saturday night, but quiets down fairly early. The building has decent sound protection. If you are bothered by any sound at night, Zona Rosa is probably not the best neighborhood to pick. And the breakfast could be better. When I go back which I will, I'll probably get breakfast someplace else, especially because there is coffee in the room. The service is good. They are polite. It's clean. The food is O.K. So, if you are on business or you don't want to leave the hotel for breakfast, it's not bad. It's just not great. The service at the front desk is great. I needed a taxi at 4:00 in the morning to get to the hotel and they arranged it for me. When you are a woman taking at taxi to the airport in the middle of night, you need a safe taxi and they had someone that the hotel used who was great. That said, Mexico is not more dangerous than it was a few years ago. It's a great time to go because the sensationalistic coverage of the border violence, has scared away a lot of tourism, so you can get great deals and even at the height of the normal tourist season, the sites are not super crowded. The Palacio de Bellas Artes wasn't crowded, so I got to stare at the Diego Rivera murals for as long as I wanted this time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Breakfast, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: waterdance
Reviews.Content: My first tripadvisor review. I read a lot of reviews about this place so decided to stay for 3 nights. When I got to the hotel, I thought I was in a bad neighborhood, but I discovered I was wrong. The room had a suite. You could still here some streetnoise. Not the softest bed in the world. One bedroom with a separate parlor wish a couch that was also a fold out bed. There was a fridge. A tv in the parlor and the bedroom. the bathroom had a whirlpool tub that worked well. Don't plan on using the sauna on the room. Water was cold and required a prior request for use. The gym was above average with an elliptical exercisor. Breakfast was excellent with 6 hot dishes, 3 usually mexican items, a platter of cold cuts, a platter of cheese, a platter of breads, 2 platter of cut fruits, 2 baskets of fruits, a selection of yogurts, drinks, and cereals. The metro was 5 minute walk away. Turibus stop was 10 minutes away. Lot of food options within walking distance, including the usual McDonalds, Burger King, Wendy's, Sanbornes, starbucks, 7-11.. Lots of restaurants!! 2 bottles of water in the room everyday. All the typical toiletries supplied. I tool the pyramid tour offered at the hotel for USD 40 and it was great and convenient, except of course the usual tourist trap stores they stop at. WIFI and a computer room. The GM gave me a better rate when he found out i was going to check out another place. They don't let you leave. They really do try to earn your business. Some of the desk people don't have the greatest English. But most were very good.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: TeemuF
Reviews.Content: Good location, good quality, good price, good service, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Great Location for the Right Price”
Reviews.Author: IxChel3300
Reviews.Content: What a find! Small, clean, friendly hotel in the heart of the zona rosa. Numerous reataurants and shops within walking distance. The hotel is a bit dated and walls are a bit thin, but clean and well run. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Only negative was bad bathroom lighting, but that seems to be true almost no matter where you go or what you pay. We booked through Mexicana Vacations and got a rate of $56.00 per night including taxes! When I go back to Mexico City, I'll be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of amenities for the price”
Reviews.Author: deltanet
Reviews.Content: Excellent value. Of my multiple stays in Mexico City, this was clearly the most comfortable. The weak point is the wireless internet service: a mere 500 kbps speed, with frequent outages. Otherwise, I was pleased with the accommodations: plenty of room; good work space; amenities such as microwave, coffee pot, and mini-fridge; an ample buffet breakfast; and helpful staff. The location is ideal; just 2 blocks from the Metrobus line and equally close to the Insurgentes Metro stop. A strong recommendation. (I have already booked my next stay.)

Reviews.Title: “great value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: carbononyc
Reviews.Content: 2nd stay at Eurostars. Located in Londres and Genova, we chose the location for a long weekend of fun in Zona Rosa. I have stayed here for business as well, it is excellent value, all suites, very spacious. Bathrooms are nice but tubs are rather small and poorly designed. spacious living room area and very very clean. Service is attentive, although could be friendlier and maybe a little more efficient. Breakfast was included in $60/night rate, buffet offers a good range of food and fruit and eggs are cooked a la carte by kitchen staff. will definetly stay here next time in MEX. I prefer to walk around lively Zona Rosa than to stay in upper class Polanco, where a car is essential. The Hotel is a block away from major transport hub, and taxis are readily available. Just choose a taxi with the proper license featured on the passenger's window for safety reasons. Relax and Enjoy this wonderful city, which suffers an undeserved bad rep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for central Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: GordonandMichael
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and had a speedy check in. The room was excellent with a separate bedroom and lounge. Breakfast was excellent with a choice of fresh fruit, cereals, cakes and hot dishes. The hotel is in a great location, and is ideally placed for sightseeing. We also arranged a tour of the pyramids through the hotel and this was great value at USD 40 per person for a 7 hour trip. The only downside to the hotel is the noise from the local clubs. We had a room at the front and the music was still going on at 3am on the Friday/Saturday nights (it finished at 10pm on Thursday).... for us, we had our earplugs and slept well. Ask for a room at the back or bring your earplugs. This is the only thing that stops us rating this as "excellent". Michael and Gordon

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: RKHosey
Reviews.Content: Nicer than I expected--good breakfast included. Great neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: David N
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with a very friendly, helpful English-speaking staff. The suites are comfortable and spacious, and I had no problems with the wireless internet which is included in the price of the room. The breakfast buffet is excellent. Concierge service couldn't be better. The location of this hotel is perfect. Zona Rosa has plenty of shopping, good restaurants and nightlife, and it is a short taxi ride to Centro Historico, Polanco, La Roma, La Condesa and the major cultural museums. This is not a luxury hotel, but very clean, comfortable and friendly and you can't beat these accommodations for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Too Rude Security”
Reviews.Author: optionsf
Reviews.Content: I like to visit Mexico City on a regular basis and have friends there I like to visit, who often visit me in my city. What's the point of having a suite, with a living room, if you can't have friends over for cocktails before going out? Two friends came by around 10pm after I had checked in and were not permitted upstairs...claiming no one could visit so late. So we had to go out to a nearby restaurant. This is ridiculous. I would claim they were homophobic, but they are in the middle of the gay zone and have lots of gay guests, so who knows? I have stayed there at least 4 times, and thought it nice for the money and a great location. But this episode pissed me off, and I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: JeffMurrell
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve stayed in some of the best hotels in New York, Chicago, Paris and New Orleans, and this hotel rivals them all. The service was friendly, polite, responsive and help was available around the clock. There is no ice machine, but they will immediately deliver a bowl of ice cubes to your room upon request. The room was a double-bed and simply exquisite â€“ very clean with real wood floors (Brazilian cherry?), lots of living space for two adults (separate lounge area from bed with desk and lots of seating), nice wide-screen TV with a few English channels, a mini-bar/fridge stocked full of lovely little goodies (wine, beer, snacks) and coffee maker in room, and a sleek, modern Euro-style bathroom with fogged-glass doors (separate shower/toilet area from sink), take-down/hand-wand shower head and lots of closet space. Iron and ironing board in bathroom armoire. Free WiFi Internet was a real blessing. Safe for valuables also in bathroom armoire-closet. Very stylish and pretty, and located in such a quiet neighborhood, but not too far from lots of nightlife! We did not have a balcony, but we were able to throw our huge windows wide open to the sky and enjoy the beautiful nightlights in the mountains on the horizon all the same. I was able to negotiate an unbelievably good price for our 5-day stay directly with the management via email. Taxis always available right outside the front door. Exercise equipment on top floor. Potable (drinkable) water in the bathroom and other plumbing. Elevators serving all nine floors, as well as a stylish staircase. Very close to charming cafes - a short walk from the famous Angel of Independence statue and Zona Rosa. This is where you want to stay when visiting Mexicoâ€™s capitol. No question. One caveat: I speak Spanish, and you do need at least a working knowledge of Spanish to communicate with the hotel management and staff, though they did appear to speak some rudimentary English with my non-Spanish speaking wife.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Christian377
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights. The hotel is in the perfect location- there are bars and restaurants right outside of the hotel. The closest metro station is about 2-3 blocks, Reforma Ave is 2 blocks away. The hotel can call you a cab to pick you up from the lobby. The hotel itself is nice, and relatively new. This hotel is a great value at about $65/night. Most of the guests seemed to be staying for business, and it was very quiet. We did not try the restaurant, but the food looked good. The rooms are new and well kept. Free internet in the business center w/ about 6 computers off of the lobby. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They did forget to clean the room one day, but they cleaned after we told the lobby staff. They helped us book a day trip to the the ruins at Teotihuacan for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice final stop for our Mexico trip”
Reviews.Author: D_and_G_2008
Reviews.Content: 1. Great location as it is in walking distance to a major Turibus stop (the Independcia) and Reforma yet it is much more safe to live in Zona Rosa than Zocalo (the main square). Feel safe for walking at night. Moreover, Eurostar located just next to a big mall and plenty of restaurants and convenience stores can be found just around the corner. 2. helpful staff 3. Big room with a living room, a pantry, a bedroom, a bathroom and a sink with mirror separated from the bathroom. There are 2 TVs: in both bedroom and living room. Feel like living at home instead of hotel The breakfast doesn't worth the price. As there are lots of eating places nearby, try not to pay for room+breakfast package if possible. The major shortfall is that the free WiFi access is limited to 1 hour per day. Any other hotels could have offered free access all thro' your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pay by the day in a developing country sort of way...”
Reviews.Author: 4whatitsworth2day
Reviews.Content: OK but regrettably this Eurostars falls short in significant areas. I stayed two weeks last year and was pleased and booked again. I just completed the return visit and will definitely look for alternatives for my next visit. Location, room furnishing, cleanliness, bell and concierge services were very good. Unfortunately, the front desk and breakfast service need improvement. The rate at checkout was not as quoted, nor was there a manager on duty to make adjustment, delaying my early morning airport departure. Chaos ensued. Breakfast quoted in room rate was not honored and thus extra fees and unexplained charges. I will contest these with my credit card company. Offerings at breakfast were one day good, one day bad. Overall they were sketchy, undependable, and service off the mark for this class hotel. In contrast to what you might read at online booking agencies, the hotel has but one room style â€“ two room suite with two double beds. This Eurostars hotel is not the worst option, but if you choose to stay here, book the lesser rate and then discuss extra person and breakfast charges upon arrival. There are a number of restaurants for breakfast and dinner in the area, as well as other competitive hotel options. Be sure to shop around. Also, the metro is but two blocks away. Summing it up, the bell and concierge services were excellent, but unfortunately and sadly, itâ€™s best to pay day by day in a developing country sort of way.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location - but read this to save money”
Reviews.Author: darrenbayley
Reviews.Content: Back in Mexico City and staying at Eurostars, Zona Rosa Suites a year after my first visit - however once again I have to say please read this full review before booking, for your own benefit. Eurostars Zona Rosa Suites is superb hotel, situated in a fantastic location in the heart of Zona Rosa. The area is full of bars and restaurants, it's cosmopolitan (you will see what I mean) and safe at night. Its surrounded by restaurants, shops and bars too. The Suites are large, consisting on a kitchen facility, sink and microwave, living room and bedroom with large queen-size bed. The bed is very comfortable. The bathroom area consists of a separate shower/bath room with toilet, behind of a frosted glass door. The wash basin and mirror are just outside, situated in a small alcove, off of the main bedroom. See my photos for more information. I note that the size of the different suites vary considerably. As you exit the lifts, if you are allocated a suite towards the left, there will be three suites. The one on the far left is considerably smaller than the others. If you are allocated this room, simply ask to switch. They know it is smaller and will switch you without a problem. The hotel itself is well maintained, with ice machines, gym and roof top terrace for those interested. There is also a business facility with desktop PCâ€™s. All room have Wi-Fi and pay-TV for those interested. The hotel decor is now looking a little dated, but not too bad. The other Eurostar hotel in DF looks more up-to-date and is only a short walk away in Reforma. However if you do select Eurostars Zona Rosa, unless you have incredibly high expectations, you won't be disappointed. There is a breakfast served in the hotel, however with so many nice restaurants around I would carefully consider if itâ€™s worth it! The receptionists speak both Spanish (and a little English). All are very helpful. IMPORTANT: I booked this hotel, once again, via Hotels.com which is a service I have used many times before. Despite complaining about this on my last visit and being compensated for it before, they continues to do it!! There is only ONE class of suite at this hotel, yet they continue to offer different rates at hotel.com for the same thing! They call it 'Suites-European Plan' and 'Executive Double'. Book the cheapest one, they are identical rooms!! I hope that helps, you will really like this hotel and if you need any Mexico City tips let me know!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OtterWynn
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel in a great location. The rooms are suites so there is plenty of space, and price is very reasonable. The location of this hotel is great, near all kinds of nightlife, restaurants and shopping, Walking distance to Chapultec Park too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, nice concept in a premium zone.”
Reviews.Author: CRI1969
Reviews.Content: The hotel concept and decor is great ! Nice rooms and close to the Zona Rosa. Good for business travel. Unfortunately when I checked out, they charged me more than the amount I booked by internet. The person in charge couldn't do anything in order to fix the problem, and I needed to leave to the airport....I waited almost an hour ! !

Reviews.Title: “Clean, lovely staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Angiebow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, after relocating from the San Marino Suites. After the first hotel, this place is fabulous in comparison. It is a lot more modern and in the heart of the Zona Rosa area, where everything is at your fingertips. The staff were very hospitable and friendly. Only had breakfasts there. The food was ok, very different to what I am used to in Australia. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “cool place to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Antoines
Reviews.Content: Eurostars Zona Rosa suites , is a fine hotel. Almost everything is Fine but the breakfast buffet itself and service in the restaurant area arent the best of the Hotel, i mean the girl on service needs to be motivated in order she realize her job is a SERVICE ONE, maybe some smiles would better her attitude, no rude at all, but like tired and bored so they must to talk to her or Put another one in her placer A MUST. The reception morning and evening was great, kind and fast. the room seems kindda old, the bath needs and update very soon, the toilitres good enough but with no bathgel. i am almost sure that a lot of amenities in teh room, were taken to the new Eurostar Reforma( DVD PLAYER, ETC..) i guess is not a 5 stars, thats for sure but is a safe, clean and cool superior 3 stars( in room safes ,ninibar,coffe maker tray,microwave and jetted tube) one block from Metro Insurgentes, safe area always secured and a great city ..no doubt i would stay there again even the poor breakfast buffet service. Antoine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: sarahBLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights en route to and from the airport and we found it to be fantastic value. The rooms are a really good size with very comfortable bed and separate area for sofa and telly. They are well equipped with fridge, microwave, iron, ironing board, Lots of storage etc. The jacuzzi bath in the first room didn't work, but the one in the second room was fine. The location is great and about 3-4 minutes walk from Insurgentes Metro which means everything else in the city is accessable. The staff were all helpful and friendly and, although the level of english spoken wasn't great, we got by fine. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Small Hotel for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: PDXLED
Reviews.Content: We booked four extremely cheap nights at the Eurostars Zona Rosa suites through Expedia, and frankly were a bit worried about the quality. Upon arrival, all of our fears were dispelled, as we were greeted by very friendly service, a very spacious, clean, and modern suite, and all in a pretty decent neighborhood, about a five minute walk from the Insurgentes metro station. It is true that not all staff members speak English, but all were ready to help and listened politely to my broken Spanish. Our suite was far bigger than we needed, but we didn't mind the extra space. We originally had a sixth floor room that had a pretty decent view, but it had not been cleaned after the last guests, so we were moved to a third floor room with no view. The hotel's strengths definitely lie more in its cleanliess and service than stunning location, but I had no complaints. The Zona Rosa neighborhood seems to be a bit on the downswing. It's just a bit seedy, and no longer luxurious. Nevertheless, there are several decent restaurants nearby, convenience stores everywhere, and it is only a 20 minute walk to the Condesa. Despite the club noise on the Avenida Londres, no noise reached our room at night.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Paradise_Traveller
Reviews.Content: This is a small but pleasant hotel in the Zona Rosa tourist district of Mexico City. My suite was on the first floor, with no view -- which suited me fine, as it meant that the noise from the street was non-existent. There was a living area with microwave and fridge, bathroom with jacuzzi bath and two beds in the bedroom. Clean and well laid out -- bottled water supplied each day. Internet was US$15 per day, but there are a number of cheap Internet cafes within a couple of minutes walk. The area is full of bars and nightclubs so not for everyone. But it felt safe and there are many eating choices. I took the metro from the airport and the stop is only a few minutes walk away from the hotel. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, modern hotel in the Zona Rosa”
Reviews.Author: alan935
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here, using an Expedia promotion (3 nights for the price of 2) and have no complaints. The hotel was recently renovated, and my "single" was a generously sized suite with all updated furniture (including a king-sized bed) and appliances. There were two flat-paneled televisions in the suite, CD and DVD player, microwave, coffee service, mini-bar, etc. The room was extremely clean and the bathroom was spotless. The help is very friendly (although not everyone speaks English). The location is right in the middle of the Zona Rosa entertainment district, although my room faced the back and was extremely quiet. A couple of caveats: The hotel charges for wireless internet service, about $15/day. (Alot of hotels offer free wireless internet). The room was so inexpensive that I didn't mind paying it, but you need to keep that in mind when you compare hotel prices. Also, don't use the tour service recommended by the hotel. There are better touring companies offered by the larger hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Too noise to stay. Find other option out of this area.”
Reviews.Author: darwinsail
Reviews.Content: I stay at this Hotel for 5 days. The room was big, relatively new, and the staff was very nice. Unfortunately the music and noise from outside during the night was so loud I could not sleep until 3 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: sara95
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights in August 2004 in the Fiesta Americana Suites Zona Rosa. It's a neat boutique hotel in the heart of Zona Rosa on Londres street. Extrtemely convenient location, plenty of restaurants, nightlife, all just a stroll away. It is also very safe, police is always around. If you stay in Mexico city and are willing to pay for a moderately priced hotel, this is great. We were staying at the Fiesta Americana Reforma, which has a plush lobby and 3/4 restaurants but rooms are smaller and older, also nothing can beat a zona rosa location. My nine year old was travelling with us so having all the fast food joints nearby helped, so did the location of pharmacies for water, snacks etc. The frontdesk and other people in the hotel were very friendly and helpful, never charged money for local calls. They also kept most of our luggage securely while we travelled to other parts of Mexico. Roberto at the front desk, Christian, Guillermo, Roberto the bellmen, great people. They arranged tours ( go mexitours/greyline ask for Issac the tour guide, dont use Estur the other more popular tour company) private taxis, tickets for travel, everything, all our valuables were secure in their safes at the front desk. Never faced any crimes or theft, nice area, good hotel. There is just one restaurant, but you can step out and find thousands including starbucks and sanborns for breakfast and quick snacks. The hotel is all suites with a living room and also a pull out couch. Cleanliness could have been better but so many positives and a $106 price tag makes it worth your while. Try the restaurant Konditori for breakfast or coffee, fantastic baked goods and cakes, also try Michelad,a beer cocktail that I never tasted before. I loved the city and its people and didnt think that pollution was such a big deal as we are led to believe in the states.

HotelInfo.Name: Eurostars Zona Rosa Suites
HotelInfo.Address: Londres, 115 Colonia Juarez | Delegación Cuauhtemoc, Mexico City 06600, Mexico
